title: XMage computes empty possibleAttackersToBlock for flying blocker vs ground attackers
description:
When declaring blockers, XMage sometimes returns an empty target set (possibleAttackersToBlock) for a creature selected as a blocker, even though there are valid attackers to block. Observed in game_20260211_002821 (Gem3F Libby, T7): after selecting a flying creature as a blocker via GAME_SELECT, the follow-up GAME_TARGET "Select attacker to block" arrived with zero choices, despite 3 attackers (Lightning Rager, Edric, Squid Token) all attacking Libby. The same flow worked correctly on T6 with 2 choices.

Suspected cause: the server-side blocker legality check incorrectly filters ground attackers when the blocker has flying (flying means it CAN block fliers, not that it can ONLY block fliers). This is a rules engine bug in the upstream XMage combat code.

Client-side workaround: auto-cancel optional GAME_TARGET with empty choices (see blocker-target-empty-choices fix).

Server-side fix would be in Mage.Server or Mage.Common combat logic â€” requires investigation of how possibleAttackersToBlock is computed.
